challenges.title: SQL Injection Basics
challenges.description:
Find the hidden flag in this vulnerable login page. The application doesn't properly sanitize user input. Try using common SQL injection techniques to bypass authentication.

URL: http://vulnerable-app.ctf/login
Hint: Think about how you can manipulate the SQL query.

challenges.title: Caesar's Secret
challenges.description:
An ancient encryption method was used to hide this message:

GSVH R ORPV XIBKGLTIZKSR

The key is somewhere between 1 and 25. Can you decode it?

challenges.title: Hidden in Plain Sight
challenges.description:
We intercepted this image file. Our analysts believe there's hidden data embedded within it. Can you extract the secret?

Download: secret_image.png (Simulated - Flag hidden in metadata)

Tools you might need: exiftool, strings, binwalk

challenges.title: Buffer Overflow 101
XSS Playground
challenges.description:
This web application reflects user input without proper sanitization. Craft an XSS payload that will execute JavaScript and reveal the flag stored in a cookie.

URL: http://xss-challenge.ctf/search
Cookie name: secret_flag

challenges.title: RSA Weakness
challenges.description:
We captured this RSA encrypted message along with the public key. The key size seems suspiciously small...

n = 84823428793
e = 65537
c = 27856425893

Can you decrypt it?

challenges.title: Memory Corruption
challenges.description:
This binary has a use-after-free vulnerability. Can you exploit it to read the flag from memory?

Download: vulnerable_binary (Simulated)

The flag is stored at address 0x08048000

challenges.title: Directory Traversal
challenges.description:
This web server allows file downloads but doesn't validate the filename properly. Can you read the flag file?

URL: http://fileserver.ctf/download?file=document.pdf
Flag location: /etc/ctf_flag.txt

challenges.title: JWT Confusion
challenges.description:
This application uses JWT for authentication. The implementation has a critical flaw in how it validates tokens. Can you forge an admin token?

URL: http://jwt-app.ctf/api
Hint: Check the algorithm field

challenges.title: Weak Hashing
challenges.description:
We found a password hash in a database dump:

5f4dcc3b5aa765d61d8327deb882cf99

Can you crack it and submit the flag?
Flag format: flag{cracked_password}

challenges.title: Command Injection
challenges.description:
This ping utility doesn't sanitize user input properly. Can you inject commands to read the flag?

URL: http://ping.ctf/check?host=google.com
Flag location: /home/ctf/flag.txt

challenges.title: Reverse Engineering Challenge
challenges.description:
This program checks if your input is correct and reveals the flag. Can you reverse engineer the algorithm?

Download: crackme (Simulated)
Hint: The flag is XORed with a key

announcements.title: Welcome to CTF Platform!
announcements.message: Thank you for joining our CTF competition. Read the rules carefully and have fun hacking!

announcements.title: Competition Rules
announcements.message:
1. No DDoS attacks
2. No sharing flags
3. No automated tools without permission
4. Report bugs responsibly

announcements.title: New Challenges Added!
announcements.message: We've added 3 new challenges in the Reverse Engineering category. Check them out!
